original: I had done my best to show [From.GetTitledFirstName] that I do not like nor want to support [From.GetHerHim]. Finally, [From.GetTitledFirstName] realized this and talked to me about my problem with [From.GetHerHim], trying to win my support.
translation: 我尽力向[From.GetTitledFirstName]展示我不喜欢甚至不支持[From.GetHerHim]。最终，[From.GetTitledFirstName]意识到了这一点，并与我谈论我和[From.GetHerHim]的问题，试图赢得我的支持。

original: I don't change my mind that easily!
is told [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will not support [This.GetHerHim]
I relent, you have my support!
translation: 我让步，你得到了我的支持！

original: is told [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will support [This.GetHerHim]
We talked and talked, [From.GetTitledFirstName] and I, trying to resolve our issues with each other. I thought I had gotten through to [From.GetHerHim] and [From.GetSheHe] told me...
translation: 我和[From.GetTitledFirstName]反复谈了很久，试图解决我们之间的问题。我认为我已经使[From.GetHerHim]理解我了，[From.GetSheHe]告诉我……

original: ...that I will never have [From.GetHerHis] support
...that [From.GetSheHe] will support me!

My child is not gregarious like me, whenever I see someone I don't know I always take the chance to talk to them but my child is shy and would rather hide or disappear through the ground when someone tries to strike up a conversation.
translation: 我的孩子不像我那么善于交际。每当我遇到陌生人，我总是与其攀谈。但我的孩子过于害羞，当别人试图谈话时总是藏起来或者跑开。

original: Show my child how great it is to talk to people!
translation: 向我的孩子展示和其他人聊天是多么有趣！

original: The world is a dangerous place and my child knows it
translation: 世界是危险的，我的孩子了解这一点

original: I'll leave my shy child alone
I don't usually like gossip but I couldn't help agree with the gossiper. That proud courtier sure needs to get a grip on reality!
translation: 通常我不喜欢流言蜚语，但这次我忍不住赞同那个搬弄是非的人了。那个骄傲的廷臣确实需要回到现实中来了！

original: I'll talk to the courtier about the gossip
translation: 我会和廷臣谈谈那个流言

original: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] talks to [This.GetTitledFirstName] about the sin of pride
I don't want to upset anyone, I'll keep quiet
translation: 我不想打击任何人，我会保持沉默

original: It is not nice to talk about people behind their back!
translation: 在别人背后说三道四不好！

original: People are gossiping about you and your pride,' [From.GetTitledFirstName] told me and then continued talking about 'the sin of pride' and how I should 'mend my ways'...
translation: 「人们对你和你的骄傲说三道四，」[From.GetTitledFirstName]告诉了我这一点，并对我谈论着「骄傲的原罪」和我应该怎样「改正言行」……

original: I don't know what you are talking about!
translation: 我不知道你在说些什么！

original: is dismayed when [Root.GetTitledFirstName] denies knowledge about being sinful
translation: 听到[Root.GetTitledFirstName]拒绝承认背负原罪时很惊愕

original: Help me free myself from my vices!
is glad [Root.GetTitledFirstName] decided to mend [Root.GetHerHis] ways
translation: 对于[Root.GetTitledFirstName]决定改正[Root.GetHerHis]言行感到很高兴

original: After I told [From.GetTitledFirstName] about the gossip about [From.GetHerHim], I had to wait a while for [From.GetHerHis] reaction...
translation: 在我告诉[From.GetTitledFirstName]关于[From.GetHerHim]的谣言后，我必须等待[From.GetHerHis]反应……

original: [From.GetSheHeCap] didn't know what I was talking about!
[From.GetSheHeCap] asked me to help [From.GetHerHim] be free of this vice

I'd like to think of myself as a magnanimous person but I have started to feel uneasy while talking to servants. The courtiers clearly does not find it fitting for a [Root.GetTitle] to consort with the servants.
translation: 我认为我是个宽宏大量的人，但我与仆人交谈变得困难了。廷臣很显然不认为[Root.GetTitle]结交仆人很合适。

original: To hell with them!
Fine! I'll stop talking to the servants
translation: 好吧，我不会再与仆人交谈了

original: What the courtiers don't know...
People no longer interests me as much as they used to do and I never voluntarily start a conversation with anyone anymore. I have lost the §YGregarious§! trait
translation: 人们不再像以前那样吸引着我，我不再自发开始交谈了。我失去了§Y合群§!特质

original: It can be fun digging into work and see how your effort makes a difference. I have lost the §YSlothful§! trait.
translation: 埋头工作并欣赏你的努力的成就是很有乐趣的事。我失去了§Y懒惰§!特质。

original: There are people in the world that deserves my respect. I have lost the §YProud§! trait.
translation: 世界上总是有人值得我尊敬。我失去了§Y骄傲§!特质。

original: Killed the leader of the Merry Men
Ignored the Merry Men
Outfoxed by the Merry Men
Clever deception
Met the Merry Men
Highway Robber Band appears in county
The Merry Men of [Root.Location.GetName]

My sheriff came to me today, looking harried and limping slightly.\n\n'My lord, I fear I have grave news: A band of robbers and poachers calling themselves the Merry Men of [Root.Location.GetName] are on the loose in your forest. I have tried to find them but alas, to no avail. They chased me out of the forest several times, the last time an arrow hit me straight in my buttocks!'
translation: 治安官今天找到我，看上去苦恼万分，还有点跛脚。\n\n「大人，我们有麻烦了：一队自称[Root.Location.GetName]的绿林好汉的强盗和劫匪盘踞在您的森林里。我试着找出他们，却徒劳无功。他们把我赶出了森林好几次，上次他们一箭射中了我的屁股！」

original: Bwahahaha... Sorry, do go on
translation: 噗哈哈哈，屁股……抱歉，请继续

original: We need to set a trap for them!
The Merry Men makes a move...
Just ignore them
The harassing of a noblewoman

An indignant but blushing woman stormed into my great hall. She told me how a band of green-clad men had overpowered her, taken her to their hideout and forced her to yield her jewels and gold to them, everything except a simple locket. They treated her courteously and even escorted her to the edge of the forest when she had handed over her jewelry. Her shining eyes, blushing cheeks and furtive smile told me she enjoyed it.
translation: 一位且羞且恼的女贵族冲进了我的大厅。她向我控诉自己是如何被一队绿斗篷的人所制服，随后劫匪们把她带回老巢，强迫她交出了所有珠宝和金钱，只留下了一个空钱袋。在交出珠宝后，他们则有礼貌地善待她，甚至护送她回到森林边上。然而那闪烁的眼神、羞红的脸颊和飘忽的微笑告诉我，她其实乐在其中。

original: Give her some gold and send her away
Something must be done!
The harassing of a nobleman

An indignant and fuming man stormed into my great hall. He told me how a band of green-clad men had overpowered him, manhandled him when he tried to resist and taken him to their hideout where they had forced him to yield every valuable trinket he owned, even his horse! When he had stopped resisting, they treated him courteously and even escorted him to the edge of the forest after they had taken his valuables. He demanded that I would do something about 'those Merry Men in green'.
translation: 一位怒气冲冲的贵族冲进了我的大厅。他向我控诉自己是如何被一队绿斗篷的人所制服，他试图反抗，然而遭到了粗暴的对待。随后劫匪们把他带回老巢，强迫他交出了所有值钱的东西，甚至他的马！被洗劫一空后他停止了反抗，劫匪们则有礼貌地善待他，甚至护送他回到森林边上。他要求我做些什么来对付那些「绿林好汉」。

original: Give him some gold and send him away
This is outrageous!
It's a trap!

My sheriff and I discussed what we should do about the outlaws and came up with two ideas. Every man and woman who had been harassed by the bandits, including the sheriff, have been told about the leader's skill with the bow. An archery contest might lure him out of his beloved forest. Another option would be to use a disguise to find the villain and bring them to court.
translation: 我和治安官讨论出了两个制服绿林好汉的方法。所有被强盗抢劫的男女，以及治安官，都知道强盗首领精于弓术。一场箭术比赛也许能引诱他离开他的森林。另一个选择是化妆找到他们，把他们带到宫廷。

original: Too risky
An archery contest, of course!
An archery contest will be held
translation: 一场箭术比赛将被举办

original: A clever disguise should work
Archery Contest

The day was perfect for an archery contest. The sun hid between clouds, a small breeze cooled the nervous and everyone seemed happy. The targets were set and ready, all that was needed now was my signal.
translation: 这一天很适合举办箭术比赛。烈日躲在云层之间，微风平缓着人们紧张的心情，每个人看起来都很高兴。靶子已经立好，只等我一声令下。

original: Let the contest... BEGIN!
Let us see who we capture!
This might not work
The green-clad stranger

Over there! Yes, there! That's him alright. What do we do now?' The sheriff pointed at a man clad in green with a great bow in his hands. I watched him as he won effortlessly against every person foolish enough to try and match their skill against his. The man's skill with his great bow amazed me. 'This man is a great archer, too bad he's a lawless poacher living off my venison.'
translation: 「在那里！对，就是那里！就是他。我们应该怎么做？」治安官指着一个身穿绿斗篷，背上背着长弓的男子说。我看着他毫不费力地打败了所有蠢到敢于挑战他的人。这个人的长弓技巧出神入化。「这个人是个伟大的弓箭手，他是个盗贼而非我的领民真是太可惜了。」

original: Arrest and hang him!
Perhaps I could hire him and his Merry Men as gamekeepers
translation: 也许我可以雇佣他和他的绿林好汉当猎场看守人

original: The Old Man

The other contestants and I laughed hard as the old man tried to draw the bow with shaking hands. After several attempts, he finally succeeded. He closed one of his runny eyes and THUD!... It hit the bullseye. Everyone's chin hit the ground as the old man defeated his contestants one by one. The poacher we had set the trap for was nowhere to be seen, so I had to grumpily give the old man his admittedly well-earned prize: a golden arrow.
translation: 我和其他参赛者大声嘲笑着一个试图用颤抖的手拉开弓弦的老人。试了几次后，他最终成功了。他闭上了一只老花眼，然后「砰」！……箭射中了靶心。老人一个接一个地击败了他的对手，令所有人惊讶得合不拢嘴。我们设下陷阱要抓的强盗根本没出现，所以我不得不将奖品颁给了这个老头：一支金箭。

original: What happened?
The archery contest was a success and a failure
translation: 箭术比赛成功了，但也失败了

original: That didn't work
Frustration swept through my veins as the archery contest proved unsuccessful in luring and trapping the elusive poacher. Perhaps we should try something else?
translation: 失败的沮丧感冲刷着我的五脏六腑，箭术比赛被证实是一个不成功的尝试。也许我们要试试别的法子？

original: Leave him and his gang alone
translation: 不去管他和他的同伙了

original: A smelly peasant should not arouse their suspicion
translation: 一个难闻的农夫应该不会引起他们的怀疑

original: A Devil in Disguise
Devil in Disguise

I removed my beautiful fur-lined cloaks and reluctantly eased myself into a peasant's stinking clothes. A woolen tunic, a small hat and muddy boots completed my disguise. Now, me own ma wouldn't even recognize me.
translation: 我脱下了漂亮的毛皮斗篷，不情愿的穿上了散发着恶臭的农民服装。羊毛外套，一顶小帽和沾满污泥的靴子就是我的伪装。现在连我的亲妈都认不出我来了。

original: Let's see how this works...
translation: 让我们看看这管不管用……

original: Is this really befitting a [Root.GetTitle]?
Disguise revealed!
Stumbles upon the Merry Men
A stranger in green
Disguise revealed!

I had not even taken one step into the great forest before an arrow burrowed itself into the ground just in front of my toes. I froze for a short second before I started struggling to get my sword out of its hiding place. When I had finally freed my sword, a man clad in green stood before me. He held the greatest bow I ever seen with an arrow on its string aimed at me. 'Leave', he said and I obeyed immediately. Behind me, the forest echoed with thunderous laughter.
translation: 我甚至还没走进大森林，一支箭就落在我的脚趾前面不远。我呆住了一会，然后拼命从暗处拔出了我的剑。当我拔出剑后，一个绿斗篷的男子来到了我的面前。他手持长弓，弦上的箭直指着我。「离开」，他说道。我毫不犹豫地服从了。在我背后，森林里传出了雷鸣般的大笑声。

original: Blast!
Meet the Merry Men

My stomach growled louder than the wolves howling in the distance. My search for the lawless men had taken me farther into the forest than I had imagined it would. Just a couple of hours had passed since I broke my fast but it felt like days. I kept walking and reached a small brook. As I bent down for a drink, I heard laughter and faint voices of many people coming towards me. Before I could hide, they were upon me. After a thorough interrogation where I pretended to be naïve or downright stupid, they allowed me to follow them to their camp.
translation: 我的肚子发出的咕咕声甚至比远处狼嚎的声音还要大。我在搜寻绿林好汉时，不知不觉走到了比我预料之中还要远的地方。我只饿了几个小时，感觉上却像饿了好几天。我继续前进，到达了一条小溪边。当我俯身喝水时，我听见一大群人说笑和嘈杂的声音向我靠近。在我来得及躲起来之前，他们就来到了我跟前。我在他们详细的盘查中装作是一个迷了路的弱智，最后他们允许我跟着去他们的营地。

original: H-hello...
I'll run away now, bye!
Meet the Merry Men
A stranger in green

My bad mood did not improve when I arrived at a small bridge across a shallow creek and a man large in stature demanded that I pay a toll to cross the bridge. I laughed in his face and he challenged me, even though I bore a sword and he nothing but a wooden staff.
translation: 一路上我的心情一直不好，这时我来到横跨一座小溪的一座桥边。一个身材高大的男子要求我付过桥费。我嘲笑了他的脸，于是他向我挑战，尽管我手持长剑而他却只有一根木棍。

original: Easy as pie!
You win the fight
You lose the fight
Your real identity is revealed
If I promise to never return, will you let me go then?
translation: 如果我承诺再也不回来，你会放我走吗？

original: A stranger defeated

It did not seem fair to fight the man with a sword when he had a wooden staff, so I carved myself a staff before we commenced. After receiving several blows, I dodged his attack and drove the tip of my staff into his left side and as he doubled up, I hit him with all my strength. With a sigh he lost consciousness and fell into the creek. I feared he might drown so I poked at him with my staff. With a roar he exploded out of the river and up on the embankment. He grumpily admitted defeat after some persuasion and with a grimace and a limp he took me to his lawless brothers.
translation: 用长剑和木棍交战很不公平，所以在开战前我也换上了一根木棍。在防御住了几次攻击后，我发动反击，使出全身力气用木棍的顶端狠狠打在他的身体左侧，使他痛苦地弯下了腰。他惨叫一声失去了意识，跌入小溪。我怕他溺水身亡，所以我用我的木棒把他又拍醒了。一声大叫后，他跳出了小溪，跃上了河岸。他怒气冲冲地承认了失败，经过一番说服，他同意带我去见他的兄弟们。

original: As I said, easy as pie!
translation: 正如我所说的，小菜一碟！

original: A stranger victorious

I carved myself a wooden staff as it did not seem fair to use a sword against a man armed only with a staff. We exchanged blows and he was both stronger and faster than I had thought him to be. He did not seem to tire and when I lowered my staff to admit defeat, he delivered a hard blow that sent me over the bridge and into the muddy water. Roaring with laughter, he helped me get up on the bridge and slapped me so hard I coughed up the last mouthful of water I had swallowed. He insisted I would follow him and meet his gang.
translation: 用长剑和木棍交战很不公平，所以在开战前我也换上了一根木棍。我们木棍相击，他比我预料中要更强壮也更灵敏。当我垂下木棍承认失败时，他甚至气都没喘一口。他给我了狠狠一击，把我从桥上打进浑浊的河水里。他哈哈大笑着，帮我重新爬到桥上，然后扇了我一巴掌，让我把呛到的水全都喷了出来。他要求我跟随他见他的兄弟们。

original: I couldn't say no to him
A stranger suspicious

In the heat of battle, I somehow revealed to the green-clad man who I was. I tried to parry his fierce blows but I was too slow. I heard rather than felt the staff smash into my skull. When I woke up my sword, purse and opponent were long gone.
translation: 在激烈的战斗中，我不知怎的暴露了我的身份。我努力闪开他的进攻，但我太慢了。我感觉到木棍在我头上狠狠一击。当我醒来的时候，对手早已经不见了。

original: Now I will never catch him, nor the Merry Men!
translation: 这么一来我永远也别想找到他和绿林好汉了！

original: Meet the Merry Men

As I approached their hideout, songs, laughter and people talking reached my ears. It was more a small village hiding beneath and up in the trees rather than a lawless gang's lair. Women cooked, tended to children and babbled with the men who practiced their skills with bows and swords. A woman clothed in green and as skilled as any man with a bow caught my eye but before I could approach her, I was introduced to their leader who seemed restless and asked me hundreds of questions. In order to gain their trust, I had to prove myself to him and his gang.
translation: 当我接近他们的藏身处时，歌声，笑声和人们的谈话声传到了我的耳中。比起一个强盗窝来，这里更像是林中的一个小村庄。女人在做饭，照管孩子，与正在练习弓术和剑术的男人们交谈。一个穿着绿斗篷，弓术不亚于其他男子的女人吸引了我的目光。但是在我接近她之前，我就被带到他们的头领面前。头领问了我无数的问题，为了得到他们的信任，我必须向他们证明我自己。

original: Really?
Steal from the rich and give to the poor
Let's see what adventure we can find
translation: 让我们看看我们能找到什么样的冒险

original: Adventure ahead!
This is enough!
Arrest the leader of the Merry Men
This is as far as I dare take it
translation: 这是我有胆子做的最后一件事了

original: Steal from the rich

Praying he would not recognize me, I stepped out in front of my old friend and demanded he would surrender his purse. The way he looked at me, disgust mixed with fear, could only mean he did not recognize me. I had to threaten to kill him to make him let go of the purse, and I made a silent vow to try and compensate him should I be able to ever return to my castle. His purse was heavy and so was my heart as I returned to the bandit leader.
translation: 我走到我的一个老朋友面前，祈祷着他认不出来我，要求他交出他的钱包。他看我的表情混合着愤怒与恐惧，说明他并没有认出来我。我威胁要杀了他，才让他乖乖交出了钱包。我暗暗发誓，如果我回到我的城堡里，一定重重补偿他。当我回去向头领报告时，我的心情和钱包一样沉重。

original: This has gone too far!
Time to leave
Now I know where to find them
translation: 现在我知道在哪里能找到他们了

original: Betray the Merry Men
Adventure!

I insisted that the leader and I would go looking for adventure together, without any of the other Merry Men. They grumbled a bit but was silenced by the leader who thought it to be an excellent idea. As we walked down the road, we saw a man clad in horse-skin leaning against a tree. I wanted to confront the horse-man myself but the stubborn leader did not listen. While he talked to horse-man, I was attacked and tied to a tree by one of my own sheriffs! The leader of the Merry Men returned, saw me tied to the tree and killed my sheriff before he cut my ropes.
translation: 我坚持头领应该和我一起去冒险，不带上其他绿林好汉。他们抱怨了一会，但是头领觉得这是一个好主意。在我们顺着路前进时，我们看到了一个穿着马皮斗篷的男子倚靠在树上。我想独自面对那个骑手，但是顽固的头领不听我的话。当他与骑手谈话时，我遭到了突然袭击，并被我手下的一个治安官绑在了树上！幸好绿林好汉的头领折返回来，在杀死了治安官之后切断了绑住我的绳子。

original: This has gone too far!
Now what?
This was... fun?
Leave the Merry Men
Time to leave and leave them alone
Leave the Merry Men

I slunk away from the Merry Men after having had adventures, venison and flirted with the green-clad maid. I had great fun together with the outlaws and feel no need to try and change their ways, as long as their shenanigans do not affect me. They seemed rather harmless, content to hide in their forest and occasionally robbing someone who will not suffer from losing a little gold.
translation: 在我和绿林好汉们一起冒险，吃烤鹿肉，还和一个穿绿斗篷侍女调情之后，我偷偷离开了他们。我和那些强盗们过得很愉快，这使我感觉到没有必要改变他们的生活，只要他们的恶作剧不会影响到我。他们似乎是无害的，只是满足于藏在他们的森林里，偶尔打劫一下富裕得不会在乎损失一点小钱的路人。

original: Fare thee well!
Time to make a decision
What should I do about the green-clad Merry Men and their leader?
translation: 我要怎样对待那些绿林好汉和他们的头领？

original: I'll hang them!
I'll hire them as gamekeepers
translation: 雇佣他们作猎场看守人

original: Ambush!

When the snores of the Merry Men echoed throughout the forest, I snuck back home and rallied my troops. I led them straight to the band of robbers and thieves. We caught every one of the bandits, the women and children were spared and set free.
translation: 当绿林好汉的鼾声响彻整个森林时，我潜回城堡，召集起了我的部队。我率领他们直接来到了强盗们那里。我们逮捕了所有的劫匪，女人和孩子则被释放。

original: Kill them all!
If their leader becomes my gamekeeper I will spare their lives
translation: 如果他们的头领愿意成为我的猎场看守人，我会饶他们一命

original: The wedding between lady Marion and Robin
translation: 玛丽安女士和罗宾汉的婚礼

original: The Wedding

The wedding between lady Marion and Robin was held in the forest, venison was served at the wedding feast but I let it slip, for now. The bridal couple had only eyes for each other and when the fat monk started playing a slow, beautiful song about love they joined hands and danced, still gazing into each other eyes. They did not even notice when the song turned faster and the rest of the dancers followed the rhythm, but continued dancing slowly until the stars started sparkling on the clear sky.
translation: 玛丽安女士和罗宾汉的婚礼在森林里举办。婚礼的宴会上提供了烤鹿肉，但我暂时不想去一饱口福。新婚夫妇的眼中只有对方，当一个胖修士开始演奏缓慢而悦耳的爱情歌曲时，他们手挽着手开始跳舞，视线仍没有离开对方。他们甚至没有察觉到歌曲节奏在变快，当其他的舞者加快舞步时，他们依然缓慢地跳着舞，沐浴在晴朗夜空中闪耀的星光下。

original: I wish them good luck with all my heart
translation: 我全心全意祝他们幸福
